fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, International co-operation and development, Environment, Taxation, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Banking and financial services
head_office_address: New Broad Street House 35 New Broad Street
eu_initiatives: Solvency II, Benchmarking, Long-term investment funds, (ELTIFs), Alternative Investment Fund Managers Directive (AIFMD), EMIR, CMU, taxation, GDPR
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
The IPF is a member of the European Real Estate Forum (EREF), an informal alliance of 30 organisations with an interest in institutional investment in European real estate, including investors, fund and asset managers, property professionals and property companies. 
 
See: http://www.europeanrealestateforum.eu/
goals__remit:
The IPF is the leading UK property investment organisation for individual members, comprising a network of over 2,000 senior professionals drawn from across the property investment and finance market.  
The IPF is not a lobby organisation. Rather, its mission is to enhance the understanding and efficiency of property investment in all its forms (i.e. public, private, equity, debt and synthetic exposure), by both its members and other interested parties, including Government. We do this through undertaking research, running seminars/workshops and providing a forum for discussion and debate around the current topics affecting the market.
